title: Filter early
description: Apply restrictive WHERE conditions as close to the base tables as possible (inside CTEs or before joins).
code_smells: Filters applied only in the final SELECT
Large intermediate CTEs without WHERE clauses
Joins performed before obvious row-reducing filters

title: Avoid SELECT * or needless columns
description: Retrieve only the columns you need.

title: Avoid cartesian joins
description: Do not use cartesian joins unless absolutely required, as they are expensive and often accidental.

title: Avoid excessive nesting
description: Flatten queries where possible. Excessive nesting reduces readability and can harm performance.

title: Use CTEs with meaningful aliases
description: Use CTEs for complex logic and give them meaningful aliases. Always use AS when defining CTEs.

title: Capitalize SQL keywords and use snake_case
description: Capitalize SQL keywords (SELECT, FROM, WHERE) and use snake_case for identifiers to ensure consistency and readability.

title: Handle NULLs explicitly
description: Always handle NULL values explicitly in joins, filters, and aggregations to avoid unexpected results.

title: Never assume implicit ordering
description: Always use ORDER BY explicitly if order matters. Do not rely on implicit ordering from GROUP BY or engine defaults.
code_smells: GROUP BY without explicit ORDER BY when order is required

title: Prefer window functions over subqueries
description: Use window functions instead of correlated or nested subqueries for ranking, running totals, and similar patterns.
code_smells: Correlated subqueries in SELECT or WHERE
Nested subqueries for ranking or aggregation

title: Avoid SELECT DISTINCT misuse
description: Use DISTINCT only when logically required. Do not use it to mask join duplication or poor query design.

title: Consistent JOIN formatting
description: Format JOINs with each JOIN on a new line and ON clauses indented for readability in multi-join queries.
code_smells: JOIN and ON clauses inline without indentation

title: Avoid magic constants in filters
description: Do not use unexplained numeric or string constants in WHERE clauses. Use descriptive values, lookup tables, or comments.
code_smells: Hardcoded codes or flags without context
